summary: This document is an email chain from November 16, 2020, between Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney, Bobbi C. Sternheim, and an Assistant United States Attorney. The primary subject is Sternheim's request to move her client, Maxwell, to a different cell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) due to a scheduled water and heat shut-off, and logistical discussions about delivering a laptop for Maxwell to review discovery materials.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's office to request better conditions for her client at MDC and discuss logistics for discovery review.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The incarcerated client of Bobbi Sternheim, held at MDC under Bureau of Prisons register number 02879-509. The emails concern her detention conditions and legal discovery process.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: A prosecutor from the Southern District of New York corresponding with defense counsel about logistics for Maxwell's case, including delivering a laptop for discovery review.

connections.description: Sternheim is identified as the attorney representing Maxwell, advocating for her client's improved detention conditions and facilitating her legal review process.
Professional correspondence between defense counsel and prosecution regarding case logistics and client welfare issues.

events.title: Email Correspondence on Maxwell's Detention Conditions
events.description: Defense attorney Bobbi Sternheim emails the U.S. Attorney's office requesting Maxwell be moved to an interior cell at MDC due to a scheduled water and heat shut-off, and to discuss logistics for delivering a laptop for discovery review.

events.title: City Notification Regarding MDC Utilities
events.description: The City contacted the Bureau of Prisons to state that water and heat would not be shut off at MDC, contradicting earlier information.

events.title: Scheduled Water and Heat Shut-off at MDC
events.description: The NYC Department of Design & Construction planned to shut off water and heat at the Metropolitan Detention Center from 9:00 pm to 5:00 am, prompting concerns about inmate welfare.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim, 33 West 19th Street - 4th Floor, New York, NY 10011
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) under BOP register number 02879-509 as of November 2020.

Her defense attorney, Bobbi C. Sternheim, was actively advocating for improved detention conditions, specifically requesting a move from an isolation cell with two exterior walls to an interior cell due to a scheduled utilities shut-off.
A court order permitted Maxwell to review discovery materials in a dayroom area cell from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm.
The prosecution and defense were coordinating the logistics of delivering a laptop to Maxwell for her to use while reviewing discovery materials.
The correspondence highlights concerns about inmate welfare during the COVID-19 pandemic, with Sternheim's office operating remotely.
